text:
UNITED STATES NATIONAL STUDENT ASSOCIATION
2115 S STREET, N.W., WASHINGTON, D. C. 20008 • 202 / 387-5100 • CABLE / NATSTUD
BILL SHAMBLIN, Vice President
Executive Affairs
JAMES GRAHAM, Vice President
Campus Affairs
ROBERT S. POWELL, JR.
President
19 June 1969
Mr. Robert Mott
Executive Director
National Educational Radio
1346 Connecticut Ave., N.W.
Washington, D.C.
Dear Mr. Mott:
Several months ago, I submitted to the Corporation for Public
Broadcasting a proposal for a new program of radio production
related to higher education and community development.
In advising that CPB would not fund this project, Mr. Donald
Quayle suggested that I contact you to see if we might pursue any
of the programming suggestions with NER.
Unfortunately, I have not had the opportunity to follow this
suggestion up until recently, having been out of this office
during April and quite busy since that time.
I have enclosed the proposal which was submitted to CPB, and
hope you will have the opportunity to look it over. It does, I
think, have a number of ideas which NSA and NER might work on as
joint projects.
I would appreciate hearing your ideas on this, and will be
contacting your office next week to see if an appointment can
be arranged for such a discussion.
Respectfully,
Steven A. Bookshester
Program Development
end
A FREE UNIVERSITY IN A FREE SOCIETY
